title: Supply Chain Data & Reporting Analyst - ekaterra
description:
Who we are…and what we do

With an annual turnover of around €2bn, ekaterra is the world’s largest tea business, with world-class, purpose-driven brands such as Lipton, Pukka, Tazo, T2 and PG Tips. ‘eka’ is a word taken from the Sanskrit language which means unity and one purpose, while ‘terra’ represents the earth and nature. As ekaterra we are truly united in one purpose: growing a world of wellbeing through the regenerative power of plants.

In July 2022, CVC Capital Partners Fund VIII took over the full ownership of the ekaterra business from its previous owner, Unilever. As a standalone entity with a dedicated single-category focus, ekaterra is even better positioned to lead the tea industry, delivering higher growth and value, and a greater impact on the wider world. With 11 production factories in four continents and tea growing estates in three countries, ekaterra is a profitable and growing business whose brands reach hundreds of millions of consumers. It has a presence in... over 100 countries.

Under the ownership of CVC, ekaterra has an exciting future ahead with opportunities for increased investments in our iconic brands, our people, and our capabilities.  Combining the strength and scale of our brands with a focus on speed and agility, ekaterra is brewing a corporate start-up mindset that’s opening-up new opportunities for its people to flourish every day.

At ekaterra, we put consumer love at the heart of every decision. We celebrate diverse thinkers who take personal ownership to connect ideas and make impactful things happen; people who share our values around humanity and courage and give their commitment to nurturing the wellbeing of all. In return, we offer a working culture that gives our people freedom and flexibility, and where they can grow both personally and professionally to master their field.

Be part of our amazing blend. Come and grow yourself and, in turn, help us to grow a world of wellbeing.

Background & Purpose of the Job

This position is responsible for supporting the reporting processes of a ~$500MM America’s Tea portfolio including iconic brands of Lipton, TAZO, Pukka, Red Rose, PG Tips, and other brands within Ekaterra. This individual will help shape the reporting landscape, gathering data and creating insights for the Supply Chain organization to improve visibility, agility and drive proactive mitigation throughout the business. You will lead the discussions and gather proper inputs of key business activities over the next 12-18 months to drive KPI reporting and views of both tactical and strategic business objectives. This individual also supports key roles within the Supply Chain to ensure operational effectiveness and efficiency.

Your Key Tasks
• You will synthesize complex data through a variety of analytical processes to drive data-driven stories and business analytics.
• Lead the development of systemic and easily understood processes to ensure continuity of reporting and analytics throughout the Supply Chain.
• Manage and transform master data elements and attributes for our portfolio to ensure reporting capabilities, visibility, and accuracy for cross functional processes are easily digestible for end users.
• Develop, maintain, and deliver KPI dashboards, reports, and templates to assist local teams on assessing and managing business health in a timely manner.
• Lead digitization for reporting leveraging new tools such as RPAs and ML. Improve productivity through automation, eliminate redundant tasks that can be applied across multiple categories.
• Support development of Tea Co. processes and technologies that are fit for purpose in the digital agenda
• Supporting the development of global Tea. Co reporting within our new SAP S4/Hana landscape.
• Supporting local team with ad-hoc report generation, requests and proof of concept reporting.

Skills and Experience
• Bachelor’s Degree with focus in an analytical discipline (eg. Logistics, applied sciences, computer science, math, statistics, economics, operations, engineering, etc.); advanced degree a plus
• A minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in operational planning, preferred focus in supply chain planning and customer service
• Knowledge of SAP S4/Hana, SAP APO
• Ability to analyze complex data sets, create strategic recommendations and processes
• Advanced abilities within Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Power BI focused)
• Advanced Excel experience required, focused on query and transformational languages (SQL, DAX, and database management)
• APICS involvement/certification a plus
• Very good command of English
• Experience with process automation, digital supply chain, RPA
• Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts in straight-forward ways to multiple levels of the organization
• Strong interpersonal skills

The qualities we look for in you

The Tea business is made up of a special blend of individuals which make our teams exciting and diverse. To be part of our tea family we are looking for individuals who think Green and are environmentally conscious, who understand the power of simplicity and who are accountable for their actions. We want those who infuse mastery and passion in everything they do to create great products and unforgettable experiences for our consumers.

What's in it for you?

We believe that growth is for everyone, we believe in growing leaders and making space to grow an owner’s mentality and like nature we adapt, we change, and we grow. We believe in connections over hierarchies and (work)levels. We have a 'corporate start-up' approach; we act with speed and agility, and we have the strength and scale of a large corporation. We are building a better world of wellbeing and a better you.

Excited about the Role? 

Please apply online. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch to provide you with an update on the status.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey

title: Data Analyst - Gamma Retail Catalyst

BCG is seeking a Data Analyst, based in Warsaw, Poland. Client Service (80%)

• Highly proactive and strong drive for (self-) improvement

• Excellent communication skills in English

• Self-motivated and is able to operate autonomously in a structured manner
• Ability to coach others
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

Education or Certifications
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, data science / statistics, or business administration

Work Experience
• Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in Tableau, including Tableau server tuning, Tableau APIs, Hyper, recent and upcoming product innovations, etc.

Oliver Wyman is a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies – www.oliverwyman.com

We are seeking a Junior Data Governance Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team!

The Opportunity:

The Data & Analytics function (dna) drives the enterprise data and analytics strategy for the firm. The dna is responsible for establishing a data foundation, building capabilities while setting standards and measurements for data quality, compliance, security, and retention of our data assets.

In this role you will be primarily responsible to support our firm-wide Data Governance and Data Quality initiatives. The successful candidate will partner with analysts embedded in the businesses and functions, to ensure our core data sets... (employees, clients, organization structures) provide a complete and accurate reflection of our business.

Our ideal candidate is passionate about the field of data, analytics and data governance where they can use their problem-solving skills and creativity to ensure high-quality in our core data elements.

The candidate should be persistent, equipped with high attention to detail and natural curiosity. Since you will be working in a DG team and will contact different stakeholders, collaborative skills are also required. You will help shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for sourcing, analyzing and interpreting data in creative ways.

Key Responsibilities:

Administrative activities and processes required for effective data management and sustainable data quality improvements.
• Assist with client/account profiles and cost centres creation and maintenance.
• Enriching the dataset by tagging client/accounts to external classification of industries, identifying and resolving inconsistencies.
• Responsible to run regular data quality checks and controls for core data sets (clients, employees, org. structures); highlight issues, conduct root-cause analysis and suggest remediation plans as necessary to improve (address) data quality.
• Partner with technology groups (data architects) to define/refine data requirements.
• Assist with creation of holistic client/account master required by PSA deployment.
• Participate in PSA UAT sessions validating various scenarios and functionalities related to client management processes.
• Prepare insights and status updates periodically.
• Identify the tools, process or process changes needed to enable and drive data accuracy and effective data management.
• Assist in development and delivery of new data sets and reports/analytics content to support business strategic decisions.

Experience Required:
• Bachelors / MS in a quantitative discipline e.g., applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, information systems, econometrics, or related field
• 0-2 years of experience in business analytics and business support functions
• Strong analytical skills and ability to collect and organise information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Knowledge and experience working with CRM platform would be an asset
• Very strong Microsoft Excel (analytical) skills
• Experience in Agile delivery methodology in a data and analytics context is a bonus
• Experience working with Tableau, Business Intelligence (BI) tools (such as: Oracle (OBIEE), Business Objects, etc.) or RMDB’s (such as SQL Server, Oracle) is nice to have
• Experience with statistical programming (R, SAS, and/or Python), a plus
• Experience working with Tableau software (Tableau Desktop, Server and Data Prep.) as a plus

Your Skills and Attributes:
• Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills required
• Ability to drive exploration and draw conclusions from multiple data sets
• Strong spirit of innovation, self-starter, independent, and with ability to come up with solutions to meet business problems
• Self-directed who can interpret data to understand trends and derive meaningful business insights for senior executives with little oversight
• Self-motivated with ability to work independently while also enjoying collaboration with cross-functional teams and other analysts
• Strong desire to learn new skills and pass knowledge acquired onto others
• Keen attention to detail with deep quantitative and analytical skills and demonstrated capacity to solve problems and enhance reporting
• Strong relationship building skills and ability to build alignment among customers and key stakeholders with demonstrated experience influencing without authority
• Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, deadline driven, highly dynamic atmosphere and react quickly to changes and shifting priorities.
• Effective communication skills (Fluent English required) and ability to translate numbers into a story
• You need to be curious by nature, understand how data is produced in our various underlying systems and how reporting and analytics content is compiled so that data can be turned into actionable business insights to support the firm’s strategy
